Tidiers for lists returned from chisq.test

Source: R/tidy_chisq.R
tidy_chisq.Rd

Tidies objects returned by the chisq.test function.

tidy_chisq(x, ...)

Arguments

x

list returned by chisq.test or svychisq
...

extra arguments

Examples

test <- chisq.test(xtabs(Freq ~ Sex + Class, data = as.data.frame(Titanic)))
tidy_chisq(test)
#>      Sex Class observed       prop   row.prop  col.prop  expected  residuals
#> 1   Male   1st      180 0.08178101 0.10398614 0.5538462 255.59973  -4.728681
#> 2 Female   1st      145 0.06587915 0.30851064 0.4461538  69.40027   9.074854
#> 3   Male   2nd      179 0.08132667 0.10340843 0.6280702 224.14130  -3.015179
#> 4 Female   2nd      106 0.04815993 0.22553191 0.3719298  60.85870   5.786457
#> 5   Male   3rd      510 0.23171286 0.29462738 0.7223796 555.24125  -1.919967
#> 6 Female   3rd      196 0.08905043 0.41702128 0.2776204 150.75875   3.684626
#> 7   Male  Crew      862 0.39164016 0.49797805 0.9740113 696.01772   6.291462
#> 8 Female  Crew       23 0.01044980 0.04893617 0.0259887 188.98228 -12.074000
#>       stdres
#> 1 -11.083954
#> 2  11.083954
#> 3  -6.993369
#> 4   6.993369
#> 5  -5.041320
#> 6   5.041320
#> 7  17.607380
#> 8 -17.607380
